intro: Bidens woodii, commonly known as the wood’s ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, and its flowers consist of yellow disk florets surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. Bidens woodii is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
